titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ الثَّانِي ( عليه السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 73 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> the 2<sup>nd</sup> (9<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>)

titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الثَّالِثِ ( عليه السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 74 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> the 3<sup>rd</sup>. (10<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>)

titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 72 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ الثَّانِي ( عليه السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 73 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> the 2<sup>nd</sup> (9<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/372)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ حَبِيبٍ الزَّيَّاتِ قَالَ

text: أَخْبَرَنِي مَنْ كَانَ عِنْدَ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) جَالِساً فَلَمَّا نَهَضُوا قَالَ لَهُمُ الْقَوْا أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ فَسَلِّمُوا عَلَيْهِ وَ أَحْدِثُوا بِهِ عَهْداً فَلَمَّا نَهَضَ الْقَوْمُ الْتَفَتَ إِلَيَّ فَقَالَ يَرْحَمُ اللَّهُ الْمُفَضَّلَ إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَيَقْنَعُ بِدُونِ هَذَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Al Waleed, from Yahya Bin Habeeb Al Zayyat who said,

‘He informed me, the one who was seated in the presence of Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>, that when they (people) arose (to leave the gathering), he<sup>asws</sup> said to them: ‘Meet Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, so greet upon him<sup>asws</sup> and renew the Covenant with him<sup>asws</sup>’. So when the people left, he<sup>asws</sup> turned towards me and he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> be Merciful to Al-Mufazzal, he was content without this’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn al-Walid from Yahya ibn Habib al-Zayyat who has said the following. “A man who was present in a meeting (of people) with abu al-Hassan al-Rida (a.s.) spoke to me of the information herein below. “When people readied themselves to leave the meeting the Imam (a.s.) said to them, “Meet abu Ja‘far (a.s.), (before you leave), offer to him greeting and renew your covenant with him.” When left, he (the Imam) said to me, “May Allah grant well-being to al-Mufaddal, he would have believed (in the succeeding Imam) without it (the command to renew their covenant)”.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/373)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: صحيح - Sahih al-Kafi (37/ 1)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَمَّرِ بْنِ خَلَّادٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) وَ ذَكَرَ شَيْئاً فَقَالَ مَا حَاجَتُكُمْ إِلَى ذَلِكَ هَذَا أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ قَدْ أَجْلَسْتُهُ مَجْلِسِي وَ صَيَّرْتُهُ مَكَانِي
وَ قَالَ إِنَّا أَهْلُ بَيْتٍ يَتَوَارَثُ أَصَاغِرُنَا عَنْ أَكَابِرِنَا الْقُذَّةَ بِالْقُذَّةِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Moammar Bin Khallad who said,

‘I heard Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> and something was mentioned, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘What is your need to that? This here is Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> whom I<sup>asws</sup> have seated in my<sup>asws</sup> seat and he<sup>asws</sup> has come to be in my<sup>asws</sup> place’.

And he<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘We<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>, the People<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> of the Household, our<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> young ones inherit from our<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> older ones, the exactness with the exactness’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Mu‘ammar ibn Khallad who has said the following. “I heard (abu al-Hassan) al-Rida who said something (leadership with Divine Authority) and then said, “I do not think you need what I just said. This is abu Ja‘far (a.s.). I have placed him in my own place to assume my position. We are of the family Ahl al-Bayt whose younger ones inherit from elder everything exactly measure to measure.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/374)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: صحيح - Sahih al-Kafi (37/ 1)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ أَبِيهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى قَالَ

text: دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ الثَّانِي ( عليه السلام ) فَنَاظَرَنِي فِي أَشْيَاءَ ثُمَّ قَالَ لِي يَا أَبَا عَلِيٍّ ارْتَفَعَ الشَّكُّ مَا لِأَبِي غَيْرِي .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from his father Muhammad Bin Isa who said,

‘I went over to Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> the 2<sup>nd</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> debated with me regarding the things, then said to me: ‘O Abu Ali! Raise your doubts! There is none for my<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> apart from me<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from his father, Muhammad ibn ‘Isa who has said the following. “Once I went to see abu Ja‘far al-Thani’s (a.s.). He debated me in several issues. He then said, “O abu Ali, there is no (reason for) doubt; I am the only son that my father had.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (374/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ أَشْيَمَ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ بَشَّارٍ قَالَ

text: كَتَبَ ابْنُ قِيَامَا إِلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) كِتَاباً يَقُولُ فِيهِ كَيْفَ تَكُونُ إِمَاماً وَ لَيْسَ لَكَ وَلَدٌ فَأَجَابَهُ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) شِبْهَ الْمُغْضَبِ وَ مَا عَلَّمَكَ أَنَّهُ لَا يَكُونُ لِي وَلَدٌ وَ اللَّهِ لَا تَمْضِي الْأَيَّامُ وَ اللَّيَالِي حَتَّى يَرْزُقَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَلَداً ذَكَراً يَفْرُقُ بِهِ بَيْنَ الْحَقِّ وَ الْبَاطِلِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ja’far Bin Yahya, from Malik Bin Asheym, from Al Husayn Bin Bashhar who said,

‘Abu Qiyama wrote a letter to Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> saying in it, ‘How can you<sup>asws</sup> happen to be the Imam<sup>asws</sup> and there isn’t a son for you<sup>asws</sup>’. So Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> answered, resembling the angry one: ‘And what would make you know that there would not happen to be a son for me<sup>asws</sup>? By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! The days and the nights will not pass by until Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Graces me<sup>asws</sup> a male child, differentiating between the Truth and the falsehood’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ja’far ibn Yahya from Malik ibn Ashyam from al-Husayn ibn Bashshar who has said the following. “Ibn Qiyaman wrote a letter to abu al-Hassan (a.s.) in which he had said the following. ‘How can you be an Imam when you do not have a son?” Abu al-Hassan al-Rida (a.s.) replied him with signs of anger, “How do you know that I will not have a son? By Allah, not many days and nights will pass before Allah will grant me a male child through who He will make the truth distinct from falsehood.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/374)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ حُكَيْمٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ لِيَ ابْنُ النَّجَاشِيِّ مَنِ الْإِمَامُ بَعْدَ صَاحِبِكَ فَأَشْتَهِي أَنْ تَسْأَلَهُ حَتَّى أَعْلَمَ فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَى الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) فَأَخْبَرْتُهُ قَالَ فَقَالَ لِي الْإِمَامُ ابْنِي
ثُمَّ قَالَ هَلْ يَتَجَرَّأُ أَحَدٌ أَنْ يَقُولَ ابْنِي وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ وَلَدٌ .

en.hubeali: Some of our companions, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Muawiya Bin Hukey, from Ibn Abu Nasr who said,

‘Ibn Al-Najjashy said to me, ‘Who is the Imam<sup>asws</sup> after your Master<sup>asws</sup>?’ So I desire to ask him<sup>asws</sup> until I do know. So I went over to Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> and informed him<sup>asws</sup>. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘The (next) Imam<sup>asws</sup> is my<sup>asws</sup> son<sup>asws</sup>’.
Then he<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘Would anyone has the audacity (courage) to say, ‘My son’, but there isn’t a son for him?’.
en.sarwar: 5. One of our people has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from Mu‘awiya ibn Hakim from ibn abu Basir who has said the following. “Al-Najashi once asked me, “Who will be the Imam after your master? I wish you ask him so I will know.” I then went to see Ali al-Rida (a.s.) and informed him (of al-Najashi’s wish).” The narrator has said that the Imam said, “The Imam will be my son.” Then he said, “Can any one say that my son will be the Imam when he has no son?”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/375)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ مُعَمَّرِ بْنِ خَلَّادٍ قَالَ

text: ذَكَرْنَا عِنْدَ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) شَيْئاً بَعْدَ مَا وُلِدَ لَهُ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ مَا حَاجَتُكُمْ إِلَى ذَلِكَ هَذَا أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ قَدْ أَجْلَسْتُهُ مَجْلِسِي وَ صَيَّرْتُهُ فِي مَكَانِي .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Mihran, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Moammar Bin Khallad who said,

‘We mentioned something in the presence of Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> after (he<sup>asws</sup> was) blessed with Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> (9<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>), so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘What is your need to that? This here is Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>. I<sup>asws</sup> have seated him<sup>asws</sup> in my<sup>asws</sup> seat, and he<sup>asws</sup> has come to be in my<sup>asws</sup> place’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ahmad ibn Mihran has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from Mu‘ammar ibn Khallad who has said the following. “Once in the presence of abu al-Hassan (a.s.) we spoke about an issue, Imamat, (Leadership with Divine Authority). It was after the birth oof abu Ja‘far (a.s.). The Imam (a.s.) said, “You do not need any such thing (thinking who the Imam will be). This is abu Ja‘far (a.s.). I have placed him in my own place and made him to assume my position.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/375)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنِ ابْنِ قِيَامَا الْوَاسِطِيِّ قَالَ

text: دَخَلْتُ عَلَى عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) فَقُلْتُ لَهُ أَ يَكُونُ إِمَامَانِ قَالَ لَا إِلَّا وَ أَحَدُهُمَا صَامِتٌ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ هُوَ ذَا أَنْتَ لَيْسَ لَكَ صَامِتٌ وَ لَمْ يَكُنْ وُلِدَ لَهُ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) بَعْدُ فَقَالَ لِي وَ اللَّهِ لَيَجْعَلَنَّ اللَّهُ مِنِّي مَا يُثْبِتُ بِهِ الْحَقَّ وَ أَهْلَهُ وَ يَمْحَقُ بِهِ الْبَاطِلَ وَ أَهْلَهُ فَوُلِدَ لَهُ بَعْدَ سَنَةٍ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ كَانَ ابْنُ قِيَامَا وَاقِفِيّاً .

en.hubeali: Ahmad, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Ibn Qiyama Al Wasity who said,

‘I went over to Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Musa<sup>asws</sup> and I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Can there happen to be two Imams<sup>asws</sup>?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No, except one of the two would be silent’. So I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘It is that. You<sup>asws</sup> are such that there isn’t a silent one for you<sup>asws</sup>’, and he<sup>asws</sup> had not (yet) been blessed with Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would be Making from me<sup>asws</sup> what the Truth will be established with and its people, and the Falsehood would be Obliterated with and its people’. So, after a year, he<sup>asws</sup> was blessed with Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>. And it was so that Qiyama (the narrator) was a Waqifite (a sect)’.
en.sarwar: 7. Ahmad has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from ibn Qiyama al-Wasiti who has said the following. “Once I went to see Ali ibn Musa (a.s.). (During the meeting) I asked him, “Can there be two Imams?” He replied, “No, but that one of them must remain silent.” I then said to him, “This applies to you. You are the Imam and there is no silent Imam with you.” At that time his son abu Ja‘far was not yet born. He said to me, “By Allah, Allah will make an Imam from me to establish the truth and the people of truth and banish falsehood and the people of falsehood. One year thereafter abu Ja‘far (a.s.) was born. Ibn Qiyama belonged to the Waqifi sect.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/375)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْجَهْمِ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ مَعَ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) جَالِساً فَدَعَا بِابْنِهِ وَ هُوَ صَغِيرٌ فَأَجْلَسَهُ فِي حَجْرِي فَقَالَ لِي جَرِّدْهُ وَ انْزِعْ قَمِيصَهُ فَنَزَعْتُهُ فَقَالَ لِيَ انْظُرْ بَيْنَ كَتِفَيْهِ فَنَظَرْتُ فَإِذَا فِي أَحَدِ كَتِفَيْهِ شَبِيهٌ بِالْخَاتَمِ دَاخِلٌ فِي اللَّحْمِ ثُمَّ قَالَ أَ تَرَى هَذَا كَانَ مِثْلُهُ فِي هَذَا الْمَوْضِعِ مِنْ أَبِي ( عليه السلام ) .

en.hubeali: Ahmad, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Al Hassan Bin Al Jahm who said,

‘I was seated with Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> called for his<sup>asws</sup> son<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was small, so he<sup>asws</sup> seated him<sup>asws</sup> in his<sup>asws</sup> lap, and he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Disrobe him<sup>asws</sup> by removing his<sup>asws</sup> shirt’. So I removed it, and he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Look between his<sup>asws</sup> two shoulders’. So I looked and there was in one of his<sup>asws</sup> shoulder, resembling a seal entered into the flesh. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Do you see this?’ The like of it was in this place from my<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 8. Ahmad has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali From al-Hassan ibn al-Jahm who has said the following. “Once I was in the presence of abu al-Hassan (a.s.). He called his son who was a small (boy). The Imams (a.s.) placed him in my lap and said to me. “ Move his shirt aside.” When I did so. The Imams (a.s.) said, “Look in between his shoulders.” I look and I found in the skin of one shoulder something like an imprint of a seal.” The Imams (a.s.) then asked, “Do you see this.? Similar to this there was one in the shoulder of my father.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (376/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ أَبِي يَحْيَى الصَّنْعَانِيِّ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) فَجِي‏ءَ بِابْنِهِ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ صَغِيرٌ فَقَالَ هَذَا الْمَوْلُودُ الَّذِي لَمْ يُولَدْ مَوْلُودٌ أَعْظَمُ بَرَكَةً عَلَى شِيعَتِنَا مِنْهُ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Abu Yahya Al Sana’ny who said,

‘I was in the presence of Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>, so they came with his<sup>asws</sup> son<sup>asws</sup> Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> and he<sup>asws</sup> was small. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This is the Blessed event which none has been begotten as being of greater Blessings upon our<sup>asws</sup> Shias than him<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 9. It is narrated from him (Ahmad ibn Mihran) from Muhammad ibn Ali from abu Yahya al-San‘ani who has said the following. “Once I was in of abu al-Hassan al-Rida (a.s.) Someone brought his son, Ja’far (a.s.) to him and he was a small (child). The Imams (a.s.) said, “This new born is one the like of whom with such great holiness and blessing has not been born for our Shi‘a (followers).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (376/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: صحيح - Sahih al-Kafi (37/ 1)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِلرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) قَدْ كُنَّا نَسْأَلُكَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَهَبَ اللَّهُ لَكَ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) فَكُنْتَ تَقُولُ يَهَبُ اللَّهُ لِي غُلَاماً فَقَدْ وَهَبَهُ اللَّهُ لَكَ فَأَقَرَّ عُيُونَنَا فَلَا أَرَانَا اللَّهُ يَوْمَكَ فَإِنْ كَانَ كَوْنٌ فَإِلَى مَنْ فَأَشَارَ بِيَدِهِ إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ قَائِمٌ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ هَذَا ابْنُ ثَلَاثِ سِنِينَ فَقَالَ وَ مَا يَضُرُّهُ مِنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَدْ قَامَ عِيسَى ( عليه السلام ) بِالْحُجَّةِ وَ هُوَ ابْنُ ثَلَاثِ سِنِينَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Safwan Bin Yahya who said,

‘I said to Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>, ‘We had asked you<sup>asws</sup> before Allah<sup>azwj</sup> had Endowed Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> to you<sup>asws</sup>, so you<sup>asws</sup> had said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Endown unto me<sup>asws</sup> a boy’. So Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Endowed him<sup>asws</sup> to you<sup>asws</sup> and our eyes are delighted. So, may Allah<sup>azwj</sup> not Show us your<sup>asws</sup> day (of passing away). So if it does happen, so to whom?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> gestured to Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was standing in front of him<sup>asws</sup>. So I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! This is a boy of three years!’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘And what would harm him<sup>asws</sup> from that? Isa<sup>as</sup> had stood with the Divine Authority and he<sup>as</sup> was a boy of three years’.
en.sarwar: 10. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Safwan ibn Yahya who has said the following. “Once I said to al-Rida (a.s.), before Allah’s granting you the blessing of the birth of abu Ja’far (a.s.) we would ask you and you would say, “Allah will grant me a son and He has granted you one. His birth is the delight of our eyes. May Allah spare us from showing your (sad) day. However, if something will happen to who then (will leadership with Divine Authority) will go?” The Imam (a.s.) pointed out with his hand towards abu Ja’far (a.s.) and he was standing before him. I then asked, “ May Allah take my soul in service for your cause, a child of three years?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “That will be of no harm to him. Jesus rose with Divine authority when he was a three years old child.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (377/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ جُمْهُورٍ عَنْ مُعَمَّرِ بْنِ خَلَّادٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ يَقُولُ لِلرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ ابْنِي فِي لِسَانِهِ ثِقْلٌ فَأَنَا أَبْعَثُ بِهِ إِلَيْكَ غَداً تَمْسَحُ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَ تَدْعُو لَهُ فَإِنَّهُ مَوْلَاكَ فَقَالَ هُوَ مَوْلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ فَابْعَثْ بِهِ غَداً إِلَيْهِ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Jamhour, from Moammar Bin Khallad who said,

‘I heard Ismail Bin Ibrahim saying to Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>, ‘My son has heaviness in his tongue, so I would be sending him to you<sup>asws</sup> tomorrow for you<sup>asws</sup> to wipe upon his head and supplicate for him, for he is in your<sup>asws</sup> Wilayah’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He is in the Wilayah of Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> (9<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) therefore send him to him<sup>asws</sup> tomorrow’.
en.sarwar: 11. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Jumhur from Mu‘mmar ibn Khallad who has said the following. “I heard ’Isma‘il ibn Ibrahim say to al-rida (a.s.), ‘My son feels heaviness in his tongue. I intend to sent him tomorrow to you. Pass you your hand over his head and pray for him. He is your Mawla (slave).’” The Imam (a.s.) said, “He is a Mawla (slave) of abu Ja’far (a.s.). send him tomorrow to him (abu Ja‘far (a.s.).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول وقيل ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/377)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ النَّهْدِيِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَلَّادٍ الصَّيْقَلِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ عِنْدَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ جَالِساً بِالْمَدِينَةِ وَ كُنْتُ أَقَمْتُ عِنْدَهُ سَنَتَيْنِ أَكْتُبُ عَنْهُ مَا يَسْمَعُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ يَعْنِي أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذْ دَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) الْمَسْجِدَ مَسْجِدَ الرَّسُولِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) فَوَثَبَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ بِلَا حِذَاءٍ وَ لَا رِدَاءٍ فَقَبَّلَ يَدَهُ وَ عَظَّمَهُ فَقَالَ لَهُ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَا عَمِّ اجْلِسْ رَحِمَكَ اللَّهُ فَقَالَ يَا سَيِّدِي كَيْفَ أَجْلِسُ وَ أَنْتَ قَائِمٌ

فَلَمَّا رَجَعَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ إِلَى مَجْلِسِهِ جَعَلَ أَصْحَابُهُ يُوَبِّخُونَهُ وَ يَقُولُونَ أَنْتَ عَمُّ أَبِيهِ وَ أَنْتَ تَفْعَلُ بِهِ هَذَا الْفِعْلَ فَقَالَ اسْكُتُوا إِذَا كَانَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ قَبَضَ عَلَى لِحْيَتِهِ لَمْ يُؤَهِّلْ هَذِهِ الشَّيْبَةَ وَ أَهَّلَ هَذَا الْفَتَى وَ وَضَعَهُ حَيْثُ وَضَعَهُ أُنْكِرُ فَضْلَهُ نَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِمَّا تَقُولُونَ بَلْ أَنَا لَهُ عَبْدٌ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Ahmad Al Nahdy, from Muhammad Bin Khallad Al Sayqal, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan Bin Ammar who said,

‘I was seated in the presence of Ali son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> Bin Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> at Al-Medina, and I was staying with him for two years, writing from him what he had heard from his brother<sup>asws</sup>, meaning Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) when Abu Ja’far Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> Bin Ali Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> entered the Masjid, the Masjid of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>. So Ali Bin Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> leapt up without any shoes nor a robe, and he kissed his<sup>asws</sup> hand and revered him<sup>asws</sup>. So Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said to him, ‘O Uncle, be seated, may Allah<sup>azwj</sup> have Mercy on you’. So he said, ‘O my Chief<sup>asws</sup>! How can I sit while you<sup>asws</sup> are standing?’

So when Ali son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> returned to his gathering, his companions went on rebuking him and they were saying, ‘You are an uncle of his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup>, and you are doing this deed with him<sup>asws</sup>?’ So he said, ‘Be silent! When it was so that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic’, and he grabbed his own beard, ‘has not Sanctified this old man and has Sanctified this youth, and Placed him<sup>asws</sup> where He<sup>azwj</sup> Placed him<sup>asws</sup>, (how can I) deny his<sup>asws</sup> merits? I seek Refuge with Allah<sup>azwj</sup> from what you are saying. But, I am a slave of his<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 12. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad al-Nahdi from Muhammad ibn Khallad al.-Sayqal from Muhammad ibn al-Hassan ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following. “Once I was in a meeting with Ali ibn Ja‘far ibn Muhammad in Madina, - I stayed with him for two years to write from him what he would hear from his brother, abu al-Hassan (a.s.),- at such time abu Ja‘far Muhammad ibn Ali al-Rida (a.s.) came in the mosque, the mosque of the Messenger of Allah. Ali ibn Ja‘far rushed towards him bare foot and without his gown. He kissed his hand and showed great respect for him. Abu Ja‘far said to him, “Uncle, please sit down, may Allah grant you well being.” He said, “My master, how can I sit when you are standing.” When Ali ibn Ja‘far returned to his place his companions began to blame him saying, “You are the uncle of his father, how can you act as such before him?” He said to them, “Be quite, When Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most gracious, has not qualified this beard –holding his beard in his hand- but has qualified this young man and has given him such position, should I deny his excellence and virtue? I seek refuge before Allah from what you say. In fact, I am a servant for him.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/378)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْخَيْرَانِيِّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ وَاقِفاً بَيْنَ يَدَيْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) بِخُرَاسَانَ فَقَالَ لَهُ قَائِلٌ يَا سَيِّدِي إِنْ كَانَ كَوْنٌ فَإِلَى مَنْ قَالَ إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ابْنِي فَكَأَنَّ الْقَائِلَ اسْتَصْغَرَ سِنَّ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ  ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ اللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى بَعَثَ عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ رَسُولًا نَبِيّاً صَاحِبَ شَرِيعَةٍ مُبْتَدَأَةٍ فِي أَصْغَرَ مِنَ السِّنِّ الَّذِي فِيهِ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Al Khayrani, from his father who said,

‘I had paused in front of Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> at Khurasan, so a speaker said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘O my Chief! If there was an occurrence (death), so to whom?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘To Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, my<sup>asws</sup> son<sup>asws</sup>’. So it was as if the speaker was belittling the (young) age of Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>. So Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Blessed and High Sent Isa<sup>as</sup> Ibn Maryam<sup>as</sup> as a Rasool<sup>as</sup>, a Prophet<sup>as</sup>, an owner of a Law, commencing during an age smaller than that which is in Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 13. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from al-Khayrani, from his father who has said the following. “Once I was standing before abu al-Hassan (a.s.) in Khurasan and someone said tp him, “O my master, if something will happen to who (will go Leadership with Divine Authority)?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “It will go to abu Ja‘far (a.s.), my son.” The person asking the question thought of abu Ja‘far (a.s.) as very young for such task. Abu al-Hassan (a.s.) said, “Allah, the Most Holy, the Most High, sent Jesus, son of Mary as a messenger prophet, the owner of a whole legal system. He began his task when he was smaller in age than abu Ja‘far (a.s.).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (378/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

parts.text: زَكَرِيَّا بْنِ يَحْيَى بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ الصَّيْرَفِيِّ

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْقَاسَانِيِّ جَمِيعاً عَنْ زَكَرِيَّا بْنِ يَحْيَى بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ الصَّيْرَفِيِّ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ عَلِيَّ بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ يُحَدِّثُ الْحَسَنَ بْنَ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ فَقَالَ وَ اللَّهِ لَقَدْ نَصَرَ اللَّهُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ لَهُ الْحَسَنُ إِي وَ اللَّهِ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ لَقَدْ بَغَى عَلَيْهِ إِخْوَتُهُ فَقَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ إِي وَ اللَّهِ وَ نَحْنُ عُمُومَتُهُ بَغَيْنَا عَلَيْهِ

فَقَالَ لَهُ الْحَسَنُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ كَيْفَ صَنَعْتُمْ فَإِنِّي لَمْ أَحْضُرْكُمْ قَالَ قَالَ لَهُ إِخْوَتُهُ وَ نَحْنُ أَيْضاً مَا كَانَ فِينَا إِمَامٌ قَطُّ حَائِلَ اللَّوْنِ فَقَالَ لَهُمُ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) هُوَ ابْنِي قَالُوا فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قَدْ قَضَى بِالْقَافَةِ فَبَيْنَنَا وَ بَيْنَكَ الْقَافَةُ قَالَ ابْعَثُوا أَنْتُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَأَمَّا أَنَا فَلَا وَ لَا تُعْلِمُوهُمْ لِمَا دَعَوْتُمُوهُمْ وَ لْتَكُونُوا فِي بُيُوتِكُمْ

فَلَمَّا جَاءُوا أَقْعَدُونَا فِي الْبُسْتَانِ وَ اصْطَفَّ عُمُومَتُهُ وَ إِخْوَتُهُ وَ أَخَوَاتُهُ وَ أَخَذُوا الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَلْبَسُوهُ جُبَّةَ صُوفٍ وَ قَلَنْسُوَةً مِنْهَا وَ وَضَعُوا عَلَى عُنُقِهِ مِسْحَاةً وَ قَالُوا لَهُ ادْخُلِ الْبُسْتَانَ كَأَنَّكَ تَعْمَلُ فِيهِ ثُمَّ جَاءُوا بِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالُوا أَلْحِقُوا هَذَا الْغُلَامَ بِأَبِيهِ فَقَالُوا لَيْسَ لَهُ هَاهُنَا أَبٌ وَ لَكِنَّ هَذَا عَمُّ أَبِيهِ وَ هَذَا عَمُّ أَبِيهِ وَ هَذَا عَمُّهُ وَ هَذِهِ عَمَّتُهُ وَ إِنْ يَكُنْ لَهُ هَاهُنَا أَبٌ فَهُوَ صَاحِبُ الْبُسْتَانِ فَإِنَّ قَدَمَيْهِ وَ قَدَمَيْهِ وَاحِدَةٌ فَلَمَّا رَجَعَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالُوا هَذَا أَبُوهُ

قَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ فَقُمْتُ فَمَصَصْتُ رِيقَ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) ثُمَّ قُلْتُ لَهُ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ إِمَامِي عِنْدَ اللَّهِ فَبَكَى الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) ثُمَّ قَالَ يَا عَمِّ أَ لَمْ تَسْمَعْ أَبِي وَ هُوَ يَقُولُ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بِأَبِي ابْنُ خِيَرَةِ الْإِمَاءِ ابْنُ النُّوبِيَّةِ الطَّيِّبَةِ الْفَمِ الْمُنْتَجَبَةِ الرَّحِمِ

وَيْلَهُمْ لَعَنَ اللَّهُ الْأُعَيْبِسَ وَ ذُرِّيَّتَهُ صَاحِبَ الْفِتْنَةِ وَ يَقْتُلُهُمْ سِنِينَ وَ شُهُوراً وَ أَيَّاماً يَسُومُهُمْ خَسْفاً وَ يَسْقِيهِمْ كَأْساً مُصْبِرَةً وَ هُوَ الطَّرِيدُ الشَّرِيدُ الْمَوْتُورُ بِأَبِيهِ وَ جَدِّهِ صَاحِبُ
الْغَيْبَةِ يُقَالُ مَاتَ أَوْ هَلَكَ أَيَّ وَادٍ سَلَكَ أَ فَيَكُونُ هَذَا يَا عَمِّ إِلَّا مِنِّي فَقُلْتُ صَدَقْتَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father and Ali Bin Muhammad Al Qasany, altogether from Zakariyya Bin Yahya Bin Al Nu’man Al Sayrafi who said,

‘I heard Ali son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> narrating to Al-Hassan Bin Al-Husayn Bin Ali Bin Al-Husayn, so he said, ‘By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Granted victory to Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>’. So Al-Hassan said to him, ‘Yes, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, may I be sacrificed for you! His<sup>asws</sup> brothers had rebelled against him<sup>asws</sup>’. So Ali son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘Yes, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, we, his<sup>asws</sup> uncles, had (also) rebelled against him<sup>asws</sup>’.

So Al-Hassan said to him, ‘May I be sacrificed for you! How did you behave, for I was not present with you all’. He said, ‘His<sup>asws</sup> brothers said to him<sup>asws</sup>, and us as well, ‘There has not been among us an Imam<sup>asws</sup> at all of a dark complexion’. So Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> said to them: ‘He<sup>asws</sup> is my<sup>asws</sup> son<sup>asws</sup>!’. So they said, ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> had judged (characters) based on appearance, therefore between us and you<sup>asws</sup> is the appearance’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You can send for them (experts in physiology), but as for I<sup>asws</sup>, so no, and do not let them know what you are inviting them for, and let them happen to be in your houses’.

So when they came, we got them to be seated in the orchard, and chose his<sup>asws</sup> uncles, and his<sup>asws</sup> brothers, and his<sup>asws</sup> sisters, and they took Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> and clothed him<sup>asws</sup> in a woollen robe and a skull cap and placed a spade upon his neck, and they said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Enter the orchard as if you<sup>asws</sup> are working in it’. Then they came with Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> and they said (to the experts in physiology), ‘Link this boy to his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup>’. So they said, ‘There isn’t a father for him<sup>asws</sup> over here, but, this here is an uncle of his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup>, and this one is an uncle of his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup>, and this is his<sup>asws</sup> uncle, and this here is his<sup>asws</sup> paternal aunt, and if there was a father of his<sup>asws</sup> over here, so he<sup>asws</sup> is the one in the orchard, for his<sup>asws</sup> feet and his<sup>asws</sup> feet are one’. So when Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> returned, they said, ‘This is his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup>!’

Ali Bin Ja’far said, ‘So I stood and I extracted the saliva of Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, then I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I testify that you<sup>asws</sup> are my Imam<sup>asws</sup> in the Presence of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’. So Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> wept, then said: ‘O Uncle! Why did you not listen to my<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> and he<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘May my<sup>saww</sup> father<sup>as</sup> be for the son of the best of the slave girls of the sons of Nubia (Sudan), the aromatic of the mouth, the excellent of the womb!’.

Woe be unto them! May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Curse the Abbasides and their offspring, the owners of the strife who have killed them (Imams<sup>asws</sup>) for years and months and days. They poisoned them<sup>asws</sup> and made them<sup>asws</sup> sick by sealed goblets, and he<sup>asws</sup> would be in exile, homeless, suffering the pain of his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> and his<sup>asws</sup> grandfather.

(as for) the Occultation, it would be said, ‘He<sup>asws</sup> died, or perished’. (No one will know) which valley he<sup>asws</sup> would be travelling in. O Uncle! Can this happen to be except from me<sup>asws</sup>?’ So I said, ‘You<sup>asws</sup> speak the truth, may I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>!’.
en.sarwar: 14. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Ali ibn Muhammad al-Qasani from Zakariyya ibn Yahya ibn al-Nu‘man al-Sayrafi who has said the following. “I heard Ali ibn Ja‘far speaking to al-Hassan ibn al-Husayn ibn Ali ibn al-Husayn as, “By Allah, Allah has supported abu al-Hassan al-Rida (a.s.).” Al-Hassan then said, “Yes, by Allah, may Allah take my souls in service for your cause, his brothers have rebelled against him.” Ali ibn Ja‘far then said, “Yes, by Allah, and we, his uncles, rebelled against him.” Al-Hassan said to him, “May Allah take my souls in service for your cause, how did you dealt it, I was not present with you.” He said, “His brothers said to him and so did we, “there has never been a blackish Imam from us” The Imam (a.s.) al-Rida said to them, “He is my son.” They said,” Messenger of Allah did judge on the basis of physiognomy , thus, we can also have a judgment on the basis of physiognomy .” The Imam (a.s.) said, “You may call one who has said the following knows physiognomy but I will not do so. You should not give information as to for what reason you have called them. You must stay home. When they will come, we should, all of us, be in the garden. His uncles, brothers and sisters should all line up. They dressed al-Rida (a.s.) in a gown made of wool with a hat of wool on his head and a shovel in his hand. The Imam should be asked to act as the gardener in the garden. Then abu Ja‘far should be brought in and they should be asked to find his father in the people present. They said, “His father is not present among these people, but this is his uncle, this is the uncle of his father, this is his uncle and this is his aunt. If his father is here he is the gardener because his foot print and his foot print matCh” When abu al-Hassan (a.s.) returned, they said, “This is his father.” Ali ibn Ja‘far has said, “I stood up and kissed abu Ja‘far and his saliva came in my mouth. Then I said, “I testify that you are my Imam before Allah. Al-Rida (a.s.) wept and said, “O uncle, did not hear my father say, “The Messenger of Allah has said, “May Allah take my souls and the souls of my father in service for the cause of the son of the best slave girl, the son of al-Nawbiya (a town in Sudan) lady with a fresh smelling mouth, the lady of who will give birth to a purified one. May Allah condemn the ’U‘aybiss (the ‘Abbassides) and their descendents, the mischief makers who murder them (the Imams) for years, months and days, cause them huge sufferings and cause them to endure bitter frustrations. He (abu Ja‘far (a.s.) he live exiled, away from home and suffering the pain of the murder of his father and grandfather. One who is has disappeared (from the eyes of his loved ones). About whom it will be said, “His is dead or perished. No one will in which valleys he will travel. Can such a person, O uncle, be anyone other than my own son?” I then said, “You have spoken the truth, may Allah take my souls in service for your cause.”
